title: When could a General Election be held and how is it triggered: all you need to know
text:
With Boris Johnson's deal passed in the House of Commons but his Brexit timetable voted down, a general election appears more likely than ever. Below, we set out how it might play out.

When could an election happen?

No10 would like to hold a late November election, with November 28 originally pencilled as a preferred date — although it has now missed the deadline for this.

By law, Parliament has to be dissolved 25 working days before the country goes to the polls. This means that for a general election to take place before the end of November this year, MPs would need to trigger it this week.
